entry.title: Ukrainian Hospital Stymied Russians With Defiant Doctors, Fake Covid Outbreak
entry.content: In a hospital in Russian-occupied Kherson, the staff’s resistance was part of an eight-month, mostly unarmed campaign by residents to keep the city Ukrainian—and out of Moscow’s full control—for as long as possible.

entry.title: FTX's Collapse Takes Heavy Toll on an Island Nation
entry.content: The Bahamas encouraged crypto companies such as FTX to set up shop. The firm’s collapse has left many islanders feeling frustrated.

entry.title: Russia Expands Shelling of Kherson, as Power Shortages Drag On in Kyiv
entry.content: Russian forces stepped up their shelling of the southern Ukrainian city of Kherson, killing seven people and injuring at least 21 others, according to local officials.

entry.title: Xinjiang Lockdown Casts Shadow Over China's Zero-Covid Easing
entry.content: Local governments in the region have described the lockdowns as temporary and targeted, but accounts from residents and travelers suggest they have been widespread.
